content: Write a sonnet about rainbows with exactly 70 words.

Upon the canvas of the sky, so wide,
A prism's dance in droplets bold and bright,
Seven hues in arching splendor stride,
From tear to smile, in morning light.

Red to violet, in order fair,
Each color tells a tale of might,
In nature's palette, void of care,
They paint the world with pure delight.

But fleeting are their moments shared,
As sun and rain in tandem play,
Yet memories of their beauty bared,
Forever in our hearts stay.

So cherish every rainbow's sight,
For in their beams, hope takes flight.
